slug: /199
title: "This Week In React #199: shadcn, Next.js, TanStack, Remix, MDX, Astro, Storybook, @svg-use, MSW, RAG, RN-WebGPU, React-Three-Fiber, Re.Pack, Super Apps, RN-macOS, EAS, Node.jx, Stage 2.7, AggregateError, Style-Observer..."

date: 09-04-2024

segments.source_content: This week, shadcn has released a new CLI, and we've noticed other nice things that are currently cooking, like support for the `use()` hook in React Query.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, shadcn a sorti un nouveau CLI, et nous avons remarquÃ© d'autres dÃ©veloppements intÃ©ressants en cours, comme le support du hook `use()` dans React Query.

segments.source_content: The React Universe Conf starts tomorrow, we're expecting React Native announcements that we will discuss next week!

segments.source_content: Join us on September 15th for a hands-on workshop with Dan Mindru, co-host of the Morning Maker show, where he'll share how he shaved 22.3 seconds off an API call using Sentry. You'll pick up practical tips on how to debug errors and performance issues using Sentryâ€™s Tracing and Session Replayâ€”RSVP to save your spot.

Vous apprendrez des conseils pratiques pour dÃ©boguer erreurs et problÃ¨mes de performance avec le Tracing et Session Replay de Sentry â€” RSVP pour rÃ©server votre place.
translations.en: Rejoignez-nous le 15 septembre pour un atelier pratique avec Dan Mindru, co-animateur de Morning Maker, oÃ¹ il partagera comment il a rÃ©duit de 22,3 secondes un appel API avec Sentry. Vous dÃ©couvrirez des conseils pratiques pour dÃ©boguer erreurs et problÃ¨mes de performance en utilisant le Tracing et Session Replay de Sentry â€” RÃ©servez votre place.

**[Shadcn prÃ©sente un nouveau CLI](https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/changelog)**

segments.source_content: Itâ€™s significantly more powerful and flexible:

translations.fr: Il est nettement plus puissant et flexible :
translations.en: Il est nettement plus puissant et flexible :

segments.source_content:
- `shadcn add` can now install components, themes, hooks, utils, dependenciesâ€¦
- It supports for multiple React frameworks (Next.js, Remix, Vite, Laravel)
- It can update your tailwind config instead of overriding it
- Components can be imported directly from urls

- `shadcn add` peut dÃ©sormais installer composants, thÃ¨mes, hooks, utilitaires, dÃ©pendancesâ€¦
- Support de multiples frameworks React (Next.js, Remix, Vite, Laravel)
- Mise Ã  jour de votre configuration Tailwind au lieu de la remplacer
- Import direct de composants depuis des URLs
translations.en:
- `shadcn add` peut dÃ©sormais installer composants, thÃ¨mes, hooks, utils, dÃ©pendancesâ€¦

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [React Component Analytics â€” Omlet Scans Your Codebase to Measure Component Usage to Increase Code Quality and Design Systems Adoption](https://omlet.dev/?utm_campaign=partner_this-week-in-react_newsletter-quick-link-aug-2024)
- ğŸ‘€ [TanStack Query PR - Add support for `React.use()`](https://github.com/TanStack/query/pull/7988): React Query plans to return a promise that you can `use()`, making it easier to integrate with Suspense in a performant way. Itâ€™s more convenient than `usePrefetchQuery` and more parallel than `useSuspenseQuery`.
- ğŸ‘€ [Remix Route Convention Evolution](https://github.com/brookslybrand/route-convention-evolution): The new `routes.ts` we evoked last week will allow you to skip filesystem-based routing, or simplify using the convention of your choice.
- ğŸ¦ [Next.js 15 may be released soon](https://x.com/feedthejim/status/1829569083777437745) without waiting for React 19 to be stable, and without requiring React 19 for the pages router. It will include major Turbopack improvements.
- ğŸ¦ [Render on Fetch vs Fetch on Render](https://x.com/t3dotgg/status/1829988532489793957): Theo shares a graphical visualization of different React rendering patterns. An associated video is available to deep dive.
- ğŸ“œ [Introducing @svg-use](https://fotis.xyz/posts/introducing-svg-use/): Greatly explains how SVG-in-JS (notably SVGR in React) is convenient for theming and distribution, but is not ideal in terms of performance and duplication. The `<use href>` pattern is a good alternative but requires manual plumbing, so the author created a toolchain to automate it.
- ğŸ“œ [Build-time Components](https://codehike.org/blog/build-time-components): Greatly illustrated article explains the benefits of React Server Components for MDX users looking to make their content interactive. Client components and build-time Remark/Rehype plugins have limitations, and RSCs offer the best of both.
- ğŸ“œ [Using Server Functions and TanStack Query](https://www.brenelz.com/posts/using-server-functions-and-tanstack-query/): TanStack Start is almost ready to use, and has a compelling data fetching approach, with â€œserver fnsâ€ integrated with react-query and routing (for prefetching), fully typesafe of course.
- ğŸ“œ [What the heck is atomic state management?](https://www.frontendundefined.com/posts/monthly/jotai-atomic-state-management/): A refresher on how to use Jotai â€œthe right wayâ€ and the benefits it brings.
- ğŸ“œ [Component testing in Storybook](https://storybook.js.org/blog/component-testing/): Storybook promotes component testing as a complement to end-to-end testing, offering speed and reliability with browser fidelity for better UI test coverage.
- ğŸ“œ [The Complete Developer Guide to React 19:](https://www.callstack.com/blog/the-complete-developer-guide-to-react-19-part-1-async-handling) A 2-part series on whatâ€™s coming in React 19, including useTransition, useActionState, useOptimistic, use, Server Components, Server Actions, ref as a prop, Diffs for Hydration Errors, Improved error reporting, Context as a provider, useDeferredValue initial value & more.
- ğŸ“œ [Easy RAG for TypeScript and React Apps](https://edspencer.net/2024/9/2/easy-rag-for-typescript-and-react-apps): Build a RAG system in TypeScript and React by processing text documents, generating embeddings, and utilizing a vector database for semantic search to answer user queries.
- ğŸ“œ [Blending Markdown and React components in NextJS](https://edspencer.net/2024/8/28/using-markdown-with-nextjs)
- ğŸ“œ [Higher Order Components (HOCs) in React: What They Are and How To Use Them](https://www.reactsquad.io/blog/higher-order-components-hocs-in-react)
- ğŸ“œ [Comprehensive React Testing: Handling API Calls with Mock Service Worker](https://www.trevorlasn.com/blog/react-testing-mock-service-worker/)
- ğŸ“œ [Using the inert attribute in React](https://www.mayank.co/notes/inert-in-react)
- ğŸ“œ [Authoring CSS in modern JavaScript apps](https://www.alexchantastic.com/modern-css-authoring)
- ğŸ“¦ [Midday V1 - Starter kit based on Next.js, Turborepo, Shadcn & more](https://github.com/midday-ai/v1)
- ğŸ“¦ [Bulletproof-React - scalable React architecture repo - now updated with Next.js examples](https://github.com/alan2207/bulletproof-react)
- ğŸ“¦ [Astro 4.15 - Astro Actions, Use rewrites for i18n fallbacks, libSQL remotes in @astrojs/db, Timeout option in client:idle, Swap helpers for ViewTransitions](https://astro.build/blog/astro-4150/)
- ğŸ¥ [Lee Robinson - Build anything with v0 (3D games, interactive apps)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zA-eCGFBXjM)
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington - Using AI Structured Output with NextJS & React](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_Rb4SpWRHC8)

segments.source_content: Blacksmith runs your GitHub Actions substantially faster by running them on modern gaming CPUs. Integrating Blacksmith is a one-line code change. 100+ companies like Ashby, GitBook, Superblocks, and Slope use Blacksmith to help developers merge code faster.

L'intÃ©gration de Blacksmith est un changement d'une ligne de code. 100+ entreprises comme Ashby, GitBook, Superblocks et Slope utilisent Blacksmith pour aider les dÃ©veloppeurs Ã  merger du code plus rapidement.

segments.source_content: At the time weâ€™re writing this, the React Native Core Contributor Summit is happening in WrocÅ‚aw.

segments.source_content: It will be followed by the React Universe conf on Thursday and Friday. A lot of exciting talks are planned, and [you can follow along on Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b48Lax2-jOQ). Some highlights: A new debugger, The New Architecture, Expo DOM Components, Static Hermes.

translations.fr: Il sera suivi par la confÃ©rence React Universe jeudi et vendredi. De nombreuses prÃ©sentations passionnantes sont prÃ©vues, et [vous pouvez suivre en direct sur YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b48Lax2-jOQ). Parmi les points forts : un nouveau dÃ©bogueur, la nouvelle architecture, les composants DOM d'Expo, Static Hermes.
translations.en: Il sera suivi par la confÃ©rence React Universe jeudi et vendredi. De nombreuses prÃ©sentations passionnantes sont prÃ©vues, et [vous pouvez suivre en direct sur YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b48Lax2-jOQ). Parmi les temps forts : un nouveau dÃ©bogueur, la Nouvelle Architecture, les composants DOM d'Expo et Hermes statique.
